website_summaries.verdict: A very heavy duty apron that will keep your tools handy and reliably protect your clothes.
pros: Nice full coverage at 27" of width
Includes a high pocket for your smartphone
Made from a good quality heavy-duty waxed canvas
Great for woodworking, but also can withstand high heat situations
cons: The straps on this apron can be difficult to use and keep fastened

customer_reviews.title: Industrial Hospital gown
customer_reviews.text: I received this apron in good order and it appeared well made. However, trying to tie this heavy apron in back left me with that "open" feeling you get from those terrible hospital gowns! Just couldn't get it tied tight enough. Tying it in front was not an option as I didn't want to risk getting it caught on shop tools. I returned it and purchased the Armor Gear with the adjustable nylon buckle in back.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome yet flawed?
customer_reviews.text: I love this apron. Feels nice. Well designed. I thought it would last for a long time. I was really excited to use it at work from now on. However the seam between the main front pockets and the kangaroo pocket underneath broke on the third day of work. So now it's like one big pocket and stuff in the front pocket spills into the back pocket. Did I just happen to get one with a seam that wasn't done right? Or is this a problem everyone is having? I'm bummed to say the least. :-(
customer_reviews.author: theycallmefrench

customer_reviews.title: Needed an apron that ccould get dirty and was durable
customer_reviews.text: Needed an apron that ccould get dirty and was durable, this apron is both. Used heat transfer vinyl on it. A gift for a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Net S.

customer_reviews.title: collects wood dust like a magnet
customer_reviews.text: This apron is not washable as it clearly states. However, other reviewers state dust and wood chips simply fall off. This did not happen for us. This apron became so clogged and covered with wood dust and chips that we finally threw it in the trash--we were dirtier using it than nothing at all! The stuff did not "fall off" as one reviewer noted, and could not be brushed off. I gave it 1 stars for durability--tough as nails but since it does not serve the purpose for which we bought it--keeping us clean in use--felt it worthless, 5 star for water resistance--stiff as a board and craftsmanship--nothing is going to tear, but overall it failed its purpose for us.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Bottom pockets collapsed and combined with big pocket
customer_reviews.text: Got one of those typical HEY BRO THANKS FOR BUYING THIS PRODUCT WILL YOU WRITE US A REVIEW? And I said sure can you tell me how I can make it so that the apron cross strap hold doesnt keep sliding up my back? Never got a response, this was like 3 weeks ago. Days after that, the bottom pockets collapsed and combined with big pocket, essentially making them useless unless I'm mounting something on their outside.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Fields

customer_reviews.title: NOT MADE IN USA
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product thinking it was made in the USA but it's not. Nowhere on thier labels is thier a country of origin. This is illegal in some countries. Make this product in the USA. There are some aprons being made in the US that cost less and quality is just as good. so your excuse of it costing to much to make should not be relevant.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Not made in America.
customer_reviews.text: I opted for this apron to support an American made product by an American small business. I didn’t mind spending more money to support this company. Upon receiving the apron the first thing I saw was the made in China tag.
customer_reviews.author: JACK POTTER

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the apron. Wanted a waxed canvas, liked the look of the black one. Would have preferred the black had pocket flaps, butnits not that big a deal. I'm a big boy. 5"11 and 330 lbs. I was a tad concerned about it fitting me. Well, it does. Perfectly...Some have mentioned the pain with the back strp and donning and removing it. I have no issues myself. I just leave it clasped and don it by putting my arms up from the bottom and then thru the arm/shoulder straps. I do a lot of bench work with very sharp edged tools. Sometimes they slip..the apron stops them without a second thought. I don't really have any down sides.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph l Carr iv

customer_reviews.title: Tough enough for this machinist
customer_reviews.text: I work in a machine shop and figured a good shop apron was in order. This one sure fits the bill. Waxed canvas seems to be a great all around material that is durable and forgiving. I’m pretty big at 6’2” and it provides awesome coverage top to bottom and side to side. The deluxe model has a buckle closure as opposed to the standard ties and it makes taking it on and off a snap. The pockets are well thought out and provide a perfect home for a phone and various tools one keeps on hand - in my case a center punch, calipers, machinists rule, and a tape measure. It isn’t too heavy or stiff. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: A serious apron!
customer_reviews.text: This is obviously well made and will last. I don't love the adjustments - I seem to end up getting my girlfriend to snug up the straps more often than not, because it's a little tricky doing it behind your back, and it seems to require re-adjusting occasionally. On the other hand, that might not be a bad thing - she, uh, REALLY seems to enjoy me wearing it, so after I'm done in the garage I usually have something else to work on back at the house, if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Lacheur

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice apron. Very durable and good for woodworkers
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice apron. Very durable and good for woodworkers. I would not recommend this apron for petite people, however. I am 5'3" and 115 lbs and this is awkwardly big on me. I've tried doubling some material at the waist, but it doesn't stay that way for long and the apron ties keep coming loose because too much of the apron wraps around the side of my body. It would be nice if someone made decent workwear sized for women and petite folks, especially stuff that is not pink or purple.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel K.

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new shop apron as I got tired of trying to empty sawdust from the pockets of the one I bought a few years ago. I spent quite a bit of time looking for information and recommendations before making my purchase. This apron was uniformly a first or second choice of every reviewer. I hesitated over the cost but finally decided that it was worth it to spend a few extra bucks to get what I wanted and needed. After all, it's not like I'm going to buy a new one every week! I've only had it a few weeks, but it's been great. Easy to get on, sturdy, and no sawdust in the pockets. Definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Retired Supt

customer_reviews.title: Quality without compromise...at an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I wasn’t sure what to expect from a heavyweight waxed canvas apron priced so cheap, and bought expecting to have to return it in disappointment. However, as soon as I removed it from the packaging, I was immediately impressed. It looks great, is well built with heavy canvas, and I fully expect it to last for years of welding and woodworking projects. Plus I love the X-back as opposed to a neck strap. It’s a bit more cumbersome to put on, but is worth it because it is so much more comfortable not having the weight of the apron and whatever you put in it pulling down on your neck.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Perisho

customer_reviews.title: Best Apron Yet
customer_reviews.text: The Hudson Apron is perfect for me. I am a pastel artist and needed an apron that would protect my clothes as well as help me manage phones, pencils, etc. I work from a wheelchair and love this apron, the pockets work for items I need allowing my hands to be free to work. The apron is stiff at first but easy to clean, keeps fluids off my clothes and body while working. The best part is it crosses at my back with no pressure on my neck. The ties are long enough to wrap around to the front. Love it and ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Robichaux-Koontz

customer_reviews.title: HD Shop Apron of great quality
customer_reviews.text: As a student and professional Machinist I needed an apron with pockets and NO entrapment hazards. This was impossible to find and I don't have the time to make one. This apron is the next best thing! It is a heavy duty, waxed cotton that offers coverage, both length and width, from the common grease, coolant and material chips found in a machine shop. I simply unstitched the apron strings on the front and reattached using snaps that can break away in case of entrapment. I also cut the length off the tie back and added snaps there too to minimize catching on anything from behind. The apron is now exactly right for me and will last for years!
customer_reviews.author: Ivy P.

customer_reviews.title: Trying to salvage
customer_reviews.text: Good size for a full grown man. Cumbersome to put on or take off. Grommet on the right side has pulled out. I like the quality of the material enough that I am going to sew up the edges of the grommet hole so I can keep using this one. Hate that I have to go to this much trouble, but in all honesty, it is extremely difficult to find a good apron for men and even with the issues this brand has, it is better than most others out on the market
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  for my application
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift from my wife for my birthday, have aprons but nothing as quality as this. I didn't want big front pockets to catch saw dust or shavings off my lathe and you have it, But i did want at least a place for some things I carry and the big front pocket is perfect including pencil and cell phone again perfect. I did not want straps around the back of my neck and you are perfect with the "X" straps. Unlike my wife I cannot make a bow behind my back and your snaps are perfect. My wife and I looked for a long time for the perfect apron and you provided it. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bob

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I was Looking for in and Apron: Sturdy, Comfortable & Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Just recently I have been learning how to turn my own wooden clubs for Indian Club training. Plus I have been making clubs and maces by hand as well. This apron is very comfortable, goes on easy, good push buckle in the back, sturdy waxed canvas, ample pockets and provides just the protection I want when I am using a file, pull knife or chisel. After working in it a few times it has broken in and is even better than when it first arrived. I find that I am now wearing it when I use other tools like my angle grinder and such.
customer_reviews.author: Rocannon MacGregor

customer_reviews.title: First Class Apron
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these. I use one in my basement shop and one in my garage shop. I bought the first one several years ago and it is still in fine condition. This is a well constructed, quality apron. The addition of quick release clasps make a great apron even better. Flying chips expelled from my metal lathe brush right off. I don't have to worry about dropping metal flakes throughout the house. Not as stiff as my previous leather apron, but that's a good thing. If you're looking for a quality product, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Fooie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Quality materials
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this product long enough to give an honest review. But first impressions tell me it is well made with quality materials. I am using it for woodcarving which I normally do on my lap. It gives me a layer of protection and the wood chips slide off easily when I am done carving. The covered pockets are great but I wish they had snaps or Velcro to secure them closed. The back straps are a little thin and get twisted easily. Neither of these issues would keep me from buying again or recommending to a friend. Quality product that should last forever for my uses!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this apron. I cook, garden, and DIY project in it. It’s the ultimate functional apron for someone that likes to get their hands dirty, but not make a mess of themselves. I’m a chick and prefer to wear yoga pants whenever possible, so the pockets are great, I can actually carry my pocket knife and cell phone around while I work. My only criticism, is that it’s a little long. It would be awesome if it came in a short or had snaps to adjust the length depending on the task. Thanks for the great product Jeremy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding apron!  Excellent customer service. Extremely well made.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice apron. Well made with very sturdy material. Excellent design, good looking with plenty of pockets. These aprons protect your clothes and you. Excellent company that stands behind their products and takes pride in what they sale. Outstanding customer service. An apron any man would enjoy wearing. The best of the best!
customer_reviews.author: RDM

customer_reviews.title: 4.7 X cooler than bib overalls!
customer_reviews.text: OK, so I'm just guessing on the water resistance, and time will tell on the durability, but it certainly appears to fit the name Hudson *Durable* Goods. This isn't an item I needed desperately, but it seems like it will get some use in my woodshop. In a previous career, I was a carpenter, and while this wouldn't replace my traditional nail apron/tool belt, I can't help thinking how cool it would have looked for a lot of jobs. Now, as an amateur, it's just handy to have some extra pockets and something besides my best jeans to get glue and varnish all over. Plus, now that my hair and beard are all grey and stuff, it just feels right.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great Apron
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. I do a lot of work in my shop and this apron has been a great addition. Being able to carry some fundamental items like pencils, marking knives, straight edges, tape measures etc in ever present and convenient to reach places seriously makes work more fun. Aside from the little things, the wear and tear protection and dust shielding is worth it alone. A fantastic product. Be warned though - this is not some frilly little disposable item. It is a serious and long lasting tool in its own right.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Jones

customer_reviews.title: Looks great online, stiff, smelly and a magnet for lint.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even used this. I received it. It smelled like vinegar. Obviously the wax that was on it had a smell. I washed it 3 times... it picked up tons of lint. I let it air dry... then in machine dried it. I used gorilla tape to lint role the apron. I then tried to iron the apron. Pictures are the finished product. Apron canvas is very dutiable. Picks up lint like crazy. Apron tie straps are cotton and cheaply made. Tie straps pick up lint as well. Should have opted for leather.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable apron
customer_reviews.text: I love this apron! I'm a broom maker and woodturner, and this apron is perfect for protecting my clothes when in the shop. I'm a small female (5'2" 130lbs) and I really love the size adjustability. It's a little long, coming to my knees, but that's actually perfect for keeping my legs dry from working with the wet broomcorn or turning green wood. The pockets are very handy, especially the large, roomy middle pocket, and it's nice to know my items are on me verses under a pile of shavings somewhere. There's nothing more frustrating than spending 20 minutes looking for that pencil you just had!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Jones

customer_reviews.title: my favorite apron
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use when school started. I wore it all the time even during lunch some days. I just love it so much. it became like my blankie. the fit is perfect and its comfy and the pockets are good and the material is very durable. when school ended I forgot it in the lab and couldn't go get it back because I moved and I'm only reviewing it now so I don't have to keep mourning when looking at the picture of it in my suggest to review. Buy this apron and love it as much as I did.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: ecellent quality
customer_reviews.text: the large sized apron is a heavy duty waxed canvas sheet that covers me to my knees (for reference I'm 6'1") It is well made and looks to be very durable, i've only had it a week so the jury is out on that long term. I'll update as becomes neccessary. It is quite stiff out of the packing but will loosen up over time as the cavnas wears in. The sides of the apron reach to about the point of my hips so it covers everything that needs it. All in all I am currently more than satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: rizlazz

customer_reviews.title: Blue collar bad a$$ery
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible apron. I love every part of this. It's a durable water wicking wax canvas so its stiff but I love it. I am a tattoo artist and it is incredible. I can keep personal items close to me and when I dont have ink and bloody gloves on I can just reach into a pocket and answer my phone or make change. Lol I really love this apron and highly recommend this to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Glover

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I do a good deal of painting and also use a lot of inks, washes, and stains etc. As a result spills can be quite an issue. I was having difficulty finding a suitable apron to thwart this and once again had to search online for something to fit the bill. This worked great. It's a bit pricey but worth it. Very durable material and fits well. Provides excellent protection for multiple jobs and has plenty of pockets for tools and equipment.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Miss having a quick release
customer_reviews.text: This is very well made, comfortable, sturdy. Not a fan of tying straps behind my back. Wish it had a quick release like the Professional Grade Chef Apron. First thing I did was cut the folded ends off the straps, grab a quick release buckle off an old backpack, and install it on the apron. Much better now. Bit of an acrobatics act getting into it with the crossed back straps, but I have a lot of trouble with my neck and can't stand any pressure on it, and the crossed straps move all the load onto my shoulders where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been having a lot of fun breaking in this apron. Any chance to do some woodworking is always a good time. I haven’t had it for too long, hence the 4 stars. Will adjust over time. Here’s my initial thoughts: Pros: -Having your wood pencils in a handy spot without them being in the way. -It’s easy to adjust for vastly different sizes. -Minimizes the amount of sawdust that gets on your clothes. -Feel like more of a professional while wearing it. Cons: -Not so good if you’re working/assembling things on the floor. It bunches up, making it a little difficult to stay kneeling.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hurner

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Apron. Too Good.
customer_reviews.text: This apron is fantastic. Fits well and keeps me 100% clean. However this apron is too good, to the point where i found myself not using it anymore. It's very protective but too heavy for my work. If your work requires continuous movement, I'd opt for a lighter apron. This apron feels like a heavy duty bullet proof vest. After several minutes, you can really feel the weight of the apron on you. It's the ultimate option for jobs like welding or cashier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price !
customer_reviews.text: The straps are sturdy and long enough to wrap around and tie in the front. Eyeloops are large enough to allow free movement and easy to adjust. the pockets are great to put a bunch of stuff in to make it so you are not always looking for that common item, like a pencil we all misplace. I'm 5'9" and this is the perfect size for me. Something as small as a loop to hang it up when not using it is a simple easy thing that is a nice feature. I would definitely recommend this as purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I love this apron
customer_reviews.text: I love this apron. I originally was going to purchase a leather one and went to many sites to compare. I almost bought a fabric one from Duluth Trading Co. but some folks complained that it was too thin and didn't fit well on a larger person. I then came across this one and found that it was plenty heavy, hung off the shoulders instead of around the neck and had many pockets and a pouch. The leather ones barely offered a pencil holder. This apron is great. My only wish would be that they offered it in a brown color but it's so dirty already you can hardly tell.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A day too late
customer_reviews.text: I had been considering getting an apron to protect my clothes from paint & glue explosions/back spray. Well, I had a big glue blowout after trying to unclog a bottle of weldbond. I ruined my trousers & shirt. I immediately placed an order for this apron. So far it stood up to a (very messy) wood staining session. It’s comfortable. It’ll take awhile to fully break in but I already love it. I just wish I ordered it sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Giff

customer_reviews.title: No complaints!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it for a bartending job. When I received it I was a little worried because of how hard the canvas was. All worries and doubts were removed once I started working. It blended and molded itself perfectly to me. I was working outdoors (Miami, Fl.) and didn't feel like I was drowning in heat because of the apron. I'm going to recommend it to coworkers.
customer_reviews.author: henry infante

customer_reviews.title: Put it on and Go to Work !
customer_reviews.text: Nice to discover a product that's made with the same quality as "they did in the old days..." I expect this apron will last as long as I will - The length is just right, pockets have flaps (so they won't collect sawdust,) a place for most all the items you need at hand. Heavy material, stitched well, pads for shoulder straps - just plain great. Now if only my woodworking was as good as my apron ... Hmmm
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mac User

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough for welding/solder work
customer_reviews.text: After years of dirty water, acid, oil, chemicals cascading down the front of my shirt and pants, I finally dicovered this apron, and it is a life changer! I can work in confidence knowing I'm protected from various situations around the shop. The pockets are big enough for whatever you need handy. Plus it was on sale for a steal! Love it. UPDATE: 4 months after I started using this product, the chemicals proved too much for the material. Once it was weak, holes started forming and growing. It's trashed now. Shame, because it was a great work apron until then.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy the covered pockets
customer_reviews.text: This apron has been a blessing with the covered pockets because with my old one I would get saw dust in the open pockets. With the covered pockets, I don't and that makes a real difference. With the adjust ability of the straps, getting it adjusted to you size is no problem. I really like this apron but would make one recommendation. I would put a reinforced strap on the right side to hold a tape measure. Reaching into the covered pocket took time to fish it out. Otherwise, it is a great apron and will be buying for Christmas presents for family members.
customer_reviews.author: joy harper

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. Not too heavy, not too light. I love the cross-your-back harness style. Simple and effective, like a military webbing. So far I use mine for BBQ. Not week-end grilling mind you, but no-sh*t all day meat smoking. Wipe the rib cleaver off on the apron and just hose it off afterward. Contours to the body nicely once worn in, like a pair of 501 jeans. Hand warmer. hoodie style from pockets nice addition. Look forward to seeing what comes next from Hudson.
customer_reviews.author: Matapez

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: This just came in today and I absolutely love it. I’m an artist and I work with paint and I also do some woodworking as part of my process and needed something durable, comfortable and could store my main tools while working and this fit the bill perfectly. The adjustable shoulder straps feel really comfortable and the material of this just feels solidly made. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas L

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not really waxed
customer_reviews.text: I got it on a lightning deal or whatever, so it was a pretty good bargain compared to the other aprons available on amazon. It's got a decent heft and thickness, and the shoulder pads do work. It has way more than enough space to a really large person. However, it's not really waxed so it gets a lot of dust and debris trapped in it. I'll have to clean it up and wax it myself at some point, if I want to stop vacuuming it after work.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Durable excellent quality Apron for people who work with tools
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6’4” husband whose always making stuff, fixing stuff. Having got him the cooking apron which is fully adjustable to any size and quality material made for wear -he was so happy with It he asked for a carpenters Apron and he is very pleased with his heavy duty waxed apron from Hudson durable goods- with pockets and places to put tools whilst you are working on a project. I fully recommend you buy from Jeremy Hudson his goods are as excellent as his service -my best wishes to both him and his small son - you won’t be disappointed with these quality goods they make great gifts
customer_reviews.author: Brit Mountain Artist

customer_reviews.title: Great Apron for Woodworkers
customer_reviews.text: Great apron for woodworking. I've used it three times, and I'm happy to report that it has sawdust all over it, and that's precisely why I bought it; to keep my clothes clean. The apron does not restrict movement, and I like how the shoulder harness and back straps secure the apron in-place. Also happy I could support a small business like Hudson Durable Goods through Amazon. Jeremy Hudson, thanks for checking in with me via email after my purchase. Take care of little Jonas, and keep making great products.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: As another poster stated it arrives very neatly folded wrapped in plastic and outwardly doesn’t appear to be substantial. Let me assure you though that initial impression is very deceiving. Once you take it out, unfold it, handle it and put it on you’ll be impressed. Made of heavy canvas and very well constructed. Haven’t had a chance to really put it to the test yet but don’t have any doubts it’ll hold up.
customer_reviews.author: SSS

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Haven't really used it much yet, but on inspection it is made from a good medium weight canvas, appears to be saturated with a water resistant paraffin that is flexible and doesn't transfer to the clothing it's meant to protect. Don't know yet if it is also resistant to oil-based stains and wood treatments like tung and danish oils. Seams are well spaced, even and finished well. The extra width breast pocket fits my cell phone, but I find having a small notepad and pencil there suit my workflow better.
customer_reviews.author: William Howell

customer_reviews.title: They mean heavy and durable when they say heavy and durable
customer_reviews.text: They also mean XL when they say XL, but thankfully with the way the straps work on this one the sizing is very easily adjusted. Pockets galore for anything and everything. No worries on my part of a pocket maybe ripping from being over lodead. I’ve hung a pnuematic nailer off of a pocket with no issues. For those curious and particular few, for reference an iPhone X and a standard pencil (not carpenter’s pencil) will juuuust fit in the top breast pocket if you slip them in right. I would seriously doubt a bigger, say iPhone Plus sized phone or something of the sorts would fit, let alone with a pencil too.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Apron for multi-sport cooking!  BBQ/Kitchen/Prep/Cleanup/ Pockets are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love the apron, I'm wearing it now as I am working on finishing up a brisket for Thanksgiving. I love the hoodie like pocket in the front, love the water resistance for washing dishes, and love how ash bounces off the front. I love how the apron terminates right at my ribcage line so my forearms dont grate against the material. Cant wait to pick up a couple more after my wallet has recovered from a massive Thanksgiving :) Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Allen

customer_reviews.title: High quality.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect when I ordered this work apron. I'm old school, and as things go these days, it seems like some standards are lacking. NOT SO for this apron. I am pleasantly surprised to find out that there are still some who produce quality products. This has not only met my needs, but it has renewed my faith in American workmanship. This is to be used as protection for milling, and I have every confidence in it's ability.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont solar

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: I added a 1" quick clasp to the ties. I hate ties, they always seem to come undone. The quick claps is the perfect solution. These are really well made and sturdy! Pretty stiff when you get them but I'm sure they'll loosen up some over time. These will protect our clothes in the shop easily from paint and oils. I got a black and the grey/taupe colored one. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: shaefus

customer_reviews.title: Hudson Apron
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to protect clothing from a project I didn't think I was going to get into when I went out. I've ruined my fair share of shirts and pants by getting into spontaneous tasks while in the shed. This apron now hangs on a handy hook ready to be put on. It's made of a nice waxed canvas, fits very well, accommodating pockets, and repels debris from the cutter & grinder, or whatever I get into. The buckle makes it very easy to put on vs having to tie straps. Great American product!
customer_reviews.author: wardog

customer_reviews.title: About TIme!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woodworker and model maker and I should have bought this apron a long time ago. It's already saved me otherwise lost parts, countless minutes of aggravation, one pair of trousers, several trips across the floor on my knees searching, and more than a couple of swear words. Appears to be well made for general indoor use--time will tell. Light enough to be comfortable, heavy enough to be durable. Easy to adjust for the right fit. It will get dirty fast but don't wash it--snap it around like a throw rug and get back to work.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This apron is very heavy, probably more suitable for mechanics than artists.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t really give an accurate review because I did not keep this apron, it was not what I thought it would be. It was too heavy for me to wear on a regular basis. I didn’t realize it might be for a mechanic with tools. I am an artist and I need full coverage and pockets, which this has, but when I put it in it was not only stiff but heavier than other aprons I use.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry Baumbusch

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy apron
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about the apron. It is well made and sturdy, and fit my husband well . However, for him in his workshop which is not truly a carpenter workshop but an amateur who makes beautiful boxes, this apron was too heavy for him and not easy to put on. He used it one day and felt it was too cumbersome for his work. We will gift it to someone who can really use it. No complaints about quality. High end.
customer_reviews.author: phyllismarie

customer_reviews.title: Apron of my dreams!
customer_reviews.text: This is the apron I've of dreamed of! All my adult life (I'm an old fart), I've had two hobbies that require an apron: cooking and cabinetmaking. Invariably, I've had to settle for aprons that are supported at the neck and gave me a neck ache., And, without exception, they had not enough pockets. This apron hangs from the shoulders, not the neck; it has many pockets and is made of a fabric that is clearly 'durable goods.' The fabric is a bit stiff out of the bag, but it's basically denim. So I reckon like Levi's old original, stiff 501 jeans, it will soften up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve E. Lansing

customer_reviews.title: I am an avid griller.
customer_reviews.text: I love the cell phone pocket so that I can check my bluetooth grill temp device. I love the pen pocket that I keep my thermometer in. I love how thick this is as I sometimes am close to high-temp heat and it blocks it nicely. I use mine 5X times per week and over a year later it looks brand new. I like it so much that I bought one as a gift for my brother for Christmas. I am 6'7" tall and 220#. It fits me great. Not many aprons are adjustable enough for us tall guys.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L. Way

customer_reviews.title: Hudson Durable Lives Up to the Moniker
customer_reviews.text: Love the apron. Bought it to use while working on my bicycles as I always seem to end up with grease on me. Lots of pockets to keep tools handy. I also bought a magnetic tool tray at the same time. Between the storage in the apron and having a place to keep greasy grimy parts I'm a much happy and organized weekend warrior!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler David Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, comfortable shop apron
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty fabric that I expect to last me for many years. Comfortable to wear for long periods - actually more comfortable than lighter aprons that I have. I purchased this apron for woodworking. Three minor issues - 1. sawdust sticks to the apron and is not easily brushed off, 2. I would prefer more pockets, particularly two or three smaller pockets, and 3. it is a little difficult to stretch the lines and attach the snap in the back when donning the apron.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Densford III

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this. The weight—yes it's heavy, but that's the idea, to have some protection from errant tools or shards. The design—pockets are in just the right places, and the matte black is just what this particular doctor ordered. The quality—made with care an thoughtfulness. I would buy from these people again in a heartbeat. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: drbliss

customer_reviews.title: They stole my apron. I liked my apron.
customer_reviews.text: It's a hardy apron. I'm in sheet metal fab and go through these at half the rate of other aprons I've tried. Plus they're harder to start on fire, which makes me harder to start on fire. Maybe I'm just bad at my job... Recently my workplace was burgled, and even among the tool chests and grinders and wrenches they snatched my lovely apron. If it's good enough for someone else to steal it's good enough for me to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Barenthsen

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! I work at a Fire Training Center and part of my job is to clean the Scott Breathing Packs every night. The soot from the burn buildings on the packs were ruining my shirts and getting on my skin. Well they laughed at me when i said i wanted a shop apron but this apron is HEAVY DUTY!! It fits well and adjusts nice and most of all keeps the soot off my skin!! Thanks for a great product!! Mikey T
customer_reviews.author: Mikey T

customer_reviews.title: My two brother being cute by just wearing bathing suits underneath
customer_reviews.text: My two brother are serious woodworkers who absolutely needed aprons like this. Look at the different weights for both my brothers and the fit is perfect for both of them. They have thanked me profusely and have already started using them. I don't know why they didn't get aprons years ago when I used to watch them woodworking! As a matter of fact, I hate woodworking!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Collins

customer_reviews.title: Apron for a life time
customer_reviews.text: My new Hudson apron replaced a 25-year-old apron which had faithfully served while being totally inefficient. The Hudson replacement is like night and day... Pockets are located where they should be, easy to access and deep enough to handle numerous tools... The over shoulder straps are great at spreading the weight... My only regret is that I took too long to replace my old apron... You can't go wrong with a Hudson!
customer_reviews.author: rvanparys

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: Apron looks to be a very durable product. Should out last me pretty easily. Fits my big arse easily. My only complaint... If you wanna call it that, is the straps connect into the clasps. Straps kept pulling out of clasps. Solved problem by wrapping a bit of electrical tape around straps after I fed them through the clasps. Other then that, rock-n-roll!
customer_reviews.author: American Patriot

customer_reviews.title: 7 Days In...
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a week, worn it a few times. So far it's great! Really liking the way it looks, feels and functions. Super adjustable, comfortable and the pockets work just right. I'm a hoodie guy and I love the hoodie pocket. I'm just getting into woodworking and this really helps out! I'm sure this will stand the test if time, will update in the future.
customer_reviews.author: L. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This apron is made from a heavy waxed canvas, If your primary concern is keeping the sawdust off your clothing, there are cheaper alternatives. I wanted something that would protect me if a drill press or band saw threw something at me, and this is the next best thing to a flack vest. Highly recommended, unless you're the type who wears flip-flops while operating a MIG welder.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Gordon

customer_reviews.title: and LOVE IT! I'm a short (5'6") 260 lbs
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Deluxe version of this apron, and LOVE IT! I'm a short (5'6") 260 lbs, and this works well for me. I kind of would like the top half of the apron to be a bit wider - I still get shavings and dust coming behind the apron by my arms. However, the amount is SIGNIFICANTLY cut down. The only real complaint I have (and the reason for the loss of a star), is that the quick-release buckles come off the straps quite easily. In fact, they came off the straps three times within the first hour. I resolved it by tying a large knot in the straps behind the buckles, and now they stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: JackRock

customer_reviews.title: it smells horrible
customer_reviews.text: haven't been able to were my nice new apron for the tile saw job and other house work presently doing.the apron arrived , opened the box and immediately the horrible smell of soured rotten clothes material poured into my house. ive since had the apron hanging in the open air and there is absolutely no change in the smell..this has been over a week now.so i can not give a rating since i can not use it..not worth 2.oo dollars if this is what i get..paid 42 for it..
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: The weight is on your shoulders--no more neck pain
customer_reviews.text: I wear this apron in the machine shop, and it has pockets for everything. I keep the tools I'm using in the lower pockets, a micrometer in the front lower pocket, pencils and the ever-useful six-inch scale. The key feature of this apron is that the weight is on your shoulders and not the neck. A few hours of working with a cheaper neck-style apron will make it abundantly clear why this is the better style. The material is quite thick, and I wouldn't have minded it being a little thinner, but it was intended for workmen with heavy duty tools in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Durable, awesome apron
customer_reviews.text: I’m a bread baker and I have worn my cotton aprons to shreds- I bought this apron about 6 months ago and it has been the best purchase! The material is heavy and durable and really takes a beating well. I didn’t take care of it as I should and recently had to soak it in warm water with some Dr Bronner’s soap and let it air dry- it’s as good as new and now I am more careful about keeping sourdough starter and flour brushed off- when that stuff gets wet, it just becomes glue! I love this apron- all of my coworkers have admired it and wished they had one for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Meg K

customer_reviews.title: The simplicity of a well-crafted apron.
customer_reviews.text: I love this apron. It slips on quickly so I'm more motivated to use it. It's very sturdy and very well made. No dangling threads, and all the eyelets are tight. It has all the hallmarks of something I'll wear for years and years! I only wish that it had pockets more designed for a block plane, a small square and a small (6") combo square. I've some work to do to modify the big pockets for these specialty items. At least, with this quality item, I feel like making that investment of time and thread is worth the effort. I'm sure I'll have this apron for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Masquith

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.  You will be glad you did!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful heavy duty apron. I use it when working in the wood shop and when working on vehicles. Saves me from getting stains on my everyday clothes. Plenty of pockets. Perhaps the thing I like best is how comfortable the arrangement is for the straps. Barely noticeable that i am wearing it and no neck or upper back pain. The quick release buckle is very handy. Overall, I am really pleased and wish I had one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: G-ManNM

customer_reviews.title: This shop apron is great. I bought this to wear while doing various ...
customer_reviews.text: This shop apron is great. I bought this to wear while doing various projects and hobbies at home and in studio. The crossover back strap holds it in place and increases comfort. It has pocket at the waist like a hoody (your hands can touch) and two individual pockets on top of that, plus another on the chest for pens, etc. The fabric is really nice, very heavy, and feels like it will last a good long while and hold up to occasional welding. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty apron
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old retired guy and I help my wife of 52 years in the kitchen when she let's me or when she isn't feeling well. I usually put her vinyl apron on when she isn't using it. But she would really rather I had my own apron. So ... I got out my Duluth catalog and started looking for their "best damn apron". Unfortunately, they are no longer available. When I saw Hudson's heavy duty apron, I knew it would meet my needs. I would have given it five stars except that one of the backpack buckles --that should have relieved my old arthritic fingers from trying to tie a bow behind my back -- was warped and non-functional.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Smith

customer_reviews.title: It breaks in for a great product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the apparent durability of this apron. It makes so much difference in the end of the day.self clean up not to mention the convenience of having my speed square, tape measure.and pencil with me all the time rather than lying it down and looking for them. They always seem to get lost on my work bench, now I know right where my most used tools are all the time. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Great shop apron to protect you and your clothes.
customer_reviews.text: Great apron. Wasn't sure what to expect of a waxed apron. Thought it might be stiff but it's not. It's compatible to new blue jeans. Apron is well made and good looking. It's more comfortable with the straps going over your shoulders rather than around your neck. I added an adjustable snap belt buckle to the waist strap making quicker to put on.
customer_reviews.author: j humms

customer_reviews.title: Great Durable Apron
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this apron for use in my machine shop. Seems to be pretty durable and the pockets are good size. They hold my phone as well as a holstered pair of 6" calipers quite well. Only dinged 1 star because I'd prefer a buckle on the straps rather than having to tie it. Easy fix as I purchased a quick release buckle for it that makes it much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this heavy duty smok. I run a waterjet shop and this smok takes a beating all day every day. Between the constant water and oils from metals and rust his smok has held up great after 6 weeks of use daily. It fits great, is definitely heavy duty, constructed well with quality materials and looks good too. The way it ties is great for the weight to be evenly distributed. I will definitely buy another when needed or when my employees need new ones.
customer_reviews.author: AMP

customer_reviews.title: Permanent Grease Stains
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product - leaves grease stains on everything it touches. Including my truck seats, which I’ve used everything and seem to be permanent. What’s the point of having a waterproof apron if you can’t wear it on clothing because it leaves grease stains? I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Offers great protection
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of sharp hand tools in my woodworking and carving. Often working on my lap. This apron helps protect my clothing from wear, small cuts and debris. Although I don't use the pockets often, the location and depth provide me with occasion storage opportunities while working. Great apron. I'm on my second one! and will order more.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This product is well designed, sturdy, and fairly priced. I have a hobby woodworking shop in my basement. This apron is perfect for my use. I also prefer buying from a small business owner who takes pride in his product. Buy it, you will like it, if not, they will refund your money up to 30 days after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LMBRME

customer_reviews.title: Love This !
customer_reviews.text: This is the best apron I've ever worn. The adjustments are easy to make and stay in place. It is heavy duty but not uncomfortable. I bought this for grilling, but it is so nice I wore it while making waffles this morning! I love all the pockets, and the waterproofing is a nice feature. Spills don't stick!
customer_reviews.author: Charles R

customer_reviews.title: Great for BBQ/chef too
customer_reviews.text: I am a home chef, and wanted something that didn't have flowers or stripes on it. This apron works great, fits great (5'10", 170lb), looks great! Great for daily prep/ cooking/ frying/ BBQing. It's heavy duty, but i wouldn't say heavy as others have. Almost same build as their kitchen apron, with added chest pocket and easy to wipe off waxed canvas. Standard 16x28" hand towels fit perfect in the hammer loops too!
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviews

customer_reviews.title: A plant nursery positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: I own a small plant nursery and wanted a heavy duty apron to protect my clothes. This apron was a excellent choice. Length and width of fabric is spot on. Ties that crisscross on your back help support the weight of what is in your pockets. I double knotted the ties at the side waist grommet instead of having to fiddle with untying at the back. This also makes it quick on and off for me. A positive suggestion would be to add some dark pink or even royal blue options. Yes dirt would show more but I would still love it.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. York

customer_reviews.title: A Christmas Win
customer_reviews.text: Bought this apron as a Christmas gift, and I’ve heard nothing but good things about it. The craftsmanship is very good. Thick material ensures safety from spills or hot materials splashing toward the torso. The pockets are great for holding many tools of the trade for an avid griller. I’m happy with my purchase and he is happy with his new apron.
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Great woodworking apron!
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur woodworker or weekend warrior. Just wanted something to protect my clothes from the dust. This is not leather but the fabric is really stiff or “coated” so it has a leather feeling. It works well with the dust. Fits well and has enough pockets for pencils, measuring tapes and other small tools
customer_reviews.author: Jeanfranco Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great for Working in the Garage
customer_reviews.text: Was really impressed with the quality of this apron. I've been getting my clothes filthy doing metalwork in my garage so it was an easy sale for me. I'm a huge fan of Adam Savage and after hearing how much he loved his shop apron, I went with this one. Keeping grime off my clothes and having my oft-used tools with me all the time has been fantastic for working on my project. I'm a large-diameter human and the long ties are plenty long for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Will not fall apart on you..
customer_reviews.text: As you can see I purchased this in Sept. 2016. Been using it for welding, tree removal, saw milling, Maintenance and repair, (tractor, aircraft, marine, diesel, gas, steam, etc). I have never wrote a review of a product before (75 years) but this after 31/2 years of everyday use I have to say this is one of the Best Buy’s I have ever made. It is working today as it was when I first used it. It will be there, working, protecting, not only you but your clothes. This works... Joe
customer_reviews.author: Joeann

customer_reviews.title: Good value and weight
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I think it should be longer. Made of sturdy materials. I don't like the attachment style. My older one has a neck loop and tie around for the waist. It's not that it's hard to put on. It's just not as convenient and doesn't work as well for me. But I would buy one like this again
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had the apron for several months and its great. Well made and durable. Will last me for a very long time. Two suggestions - 1) include some sort of buckle on the ties. Its plenty long but for me its just a little long/awkward to tie in the back and just a little short (with my belly) to tie in the front. 2) add someway to tack down the ties behind the shoulders rather than have them loose every time you put it on.
customer_reviews.author: Miner Dave

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for Grilling!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this apron for a couple of weeks but so far I love it. When I first unboxed it I was immediately impressed by the look, quality and craftsmanship. I have been using the apron for grilling and it is perfect for that use and probably for anything you want to use it for. Lots of pockets! Some have complained that it is difficult to put on due to the crossing back straps. I have no issues putting it on at all. The crossing straps makes it more comfortable and more adjustable. If I could choose one word to describe this apron it would be perfect. Love it! Would highly recommend it!.
customer_reviews.author: Donald K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Strong, very well made
customer_reviews.text: This apron was very well made. It is a truly strong heavyweight fabric and I expect it will give many years of good service. The tie straps are pretty substantial. I have found the straps on other work aprons to be a weak point as I have had some aprons where they were little more than shoe strings. The ones on this Hudson apron look as strong and well made as is the rest of this apron. Its rare to find this level of craftsmanship these days. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: DWM,Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Picture does not do this Apron justice, you have to feel it!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy but not stiff! I have half a dozen different aprons: bike mechanic style synthetic, custom leather for blacksmithing, lightweight cloth types, etc. I wanted a canvas one with great pockets---this is it! I'm 6'2" and it's long the way I wanted but pockets are within easy reach. Thought the waxed fabric was going to look odd but it's a great, uniform black It's my new favorite. So handsome I felt bad when I got it dirty. Buy one for yourself!
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Teacher
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for my woodworking shop. When I turn bowls it keeps all the wood shavings off of me and my clean up is a lot faster. The big pockets are also a big plus for keeping my small wood working tools handy. It took me a while to figure out how to adjust the straps, but other than that buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher

customer_reviews.title: good daily apron
customer_reviews.text: A little stiff but it works fine. Looks like a quality product. I wear it every day for 8 to 10 hours. It doesn't say how to clean it but I assume it can be put in the washer. I use it for wood working and it's getting pretty dirty. Overall, I think its a good purchase. Time will tell since I normally go through several each year.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: The pockets are in the perfect place, and there are hooks for hammers on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding piece of equipment. Seriously. For years, I've held off buying a full length tool apron, but after destroying the majority of any clothes I was wearing while woodworking, I finally decided to take the plunge. The fabric is thick, stiff in the beginning (but softening with use), and very capable of absorbing extreme punishment. The pockets are in the perfect place, and there are hooks for hammers on both sides. I could not have designed a more perfect garment myself. Now, paint, sawdust, sharp corners, nail scrapes, are all absorbed by this piece of apparel. My wife is happy, so I am too. Buy one. You'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Lancer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Apron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this apron as a “just because” present for my extra large husband. He can be a bit hard on things, breaking everything from car seats to book ends. (He just doesn’t know his strength, the poor dear.) I was happy to open this apron and see that it is robust and well-constructed! I think it will last him a good long while. Also, the pockets are a huge selling point! They are large enough to fit just about anything you’d need to keep handy, without being so deep so as to lose things. My only small complaint is that this apron looks tiny on that guy that I married.... but really, that’s life with a 7 foot dude.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Strange

customer_reviews.title: Great gardening apron that's not a pain in the neck
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cross-back apron to use while gardening, as I found traditional aprons rubbed too hard on my neck. This Hudson apron really fills the bill. It's great! Well made, durable, and comfortable! A small suggestion would be for a larger top pocket on the bib to allow for an iPhone, but I heartily recommend this awesome apron.
customer_reviews.author: KellKat

customer_reviews.title: Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice thick apron. It is long & is adjustable. Once you have it on, the apron stays tied & works effectively. The only drawback is the drawstring adjustment. I realize it is setup as it is to make the apron adjustable. As a 6'4" person I appreciate that it does adjust. However, getting it on is odd and not intuitive. The conventional loop is better in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

product_meta.title: Hudson Durable Goods - Heavy Duty Waxed Canvas Work Apron with Tool Pockets (Grey), Cross-Back Straps & Adjustable M to XXL
feature_bullets: BUILT-TO-LAST: Build quality that imitators can't match! Handcrafted from water resistant & rugged 16 oz waxed canvas. Reinforced with heavy-weight gun-metal grommets and rivets. Double stitched tool pockets and thick top and bottom hems for strength and structure.

ALL DAY COMFORT + CUSTOMIZED FIT: Prevent neck pain with our cross back strap design. Full coverage bib apron is 27 inches wide x 34 inches tall for unisex sizing (recommended for 5' 2" or taller individuals). Grommets + long straps allow for a range of adjustments (up to men's 50 inch waist).

VERSATILE TOOL POCKETS: Large, easy access tools/accessories pockets in front (8 x 6.5 inch each, accommodates carpenter's square). Quick access cell phone/pencil pocket on front chest. Large "kangaroo" style hand pocket.
